text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Visiting Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Velayati reiterates his country's willingness to further develop bilateral cooperation.
- Jordan's King Hussein expected on a two-day visit to Morocco.
- European Union markets glutted with Spanish and Moroccan tomato and citrus exports.
- Staff at state-owned farmers' credit bank to stage second one-day strike on Wednesday.
- A fishing boat sinks off the city of Larache, killing two while seven are reported missing.
